name: market for power adapter, for smartphone | power adapter, for smartphone | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25148/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'power adapter, for smartphone', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'power adapter, for smartphone',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'power adapter, for smartphone',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description:
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.

The type of sea transport (container ship, bulk carrier and tanker) are assigned to the products based on:

According to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD, 2018) 67.7% of dry goods were shipped in bulk, 24.3% in containers and the remaining as other dry cargo. Of bulk transport, 62% of the volume is covered by coal, iron ore and grain, products defined as “Major dry bulk commodities”. The remaining is covered by products defined as “Minor bulks”. Products listed as minor bulks in UNCTAD/RMT/2018 (UNCTAD, 2018) and UNCTAD/RMT/2017 (UNCTAD, 2017) are: bauxite, steel products, forest products, scrap, nickel ore, cement, petroleum coke and sugar. 
References:
UNCTAD (2018). Review of maritime transport. UNCTAD/RMT/2018. Retrieved from: https://unctad.org/en/PublicationsLibrary/rmt2018_en.pdf, accessed 28 February 2019
UNCTAD (2017). Review of maritime transport. UNCTAD/RMT/2017. Retrieved from: https://unctad.org/en/PublicationsLibrary/rmt2017_en.pdf, accessed 28 February 2019

Additionally, specific product information was extracted from the following freight shipping websites:
CargoHandbook, accessible at http://www.cargohandbook.com/index.php/Welcome_to_CargoHandbook, 
Transport Information Service (TIS) from the German Insurance Association (GDV e.V.), accessible at http://www.tis-gdv.de/tis_e/inhalt.html.
